result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Travarus Marcell Pierce

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Travarus Marcell Pierce in court, in custody.  Attorney Dianne Margaret Erickson in court for Travarus Marcell Pierce.  Attorney Chad Wozniak in court for State of Wisconsin. Defense motion to withdraw as counsel is GRANTED by the Court. Defense counsel will notify Public Defender's Office to appoint new counsel for the defendant. Case adjourned for Status Conference in Branch 12.  Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 34, Judge Yamahiro in Room 423 of the Safety Building. 
*
Cash bail and bail conditions remains as previously ordered.
Attorney Erickson filed Motion to Withdraw this date and requests a Motion to Withdraw Hearing.  Parties agree via email to October 13, 2022 at 8:30 am.
Motion to Withdraw received and filed.  bm
Section 971.23(9) Notice of Intent to Use DNA Evidence at Trial received and filed.  bm
Defendant's Attorney's Motion to Withdraw as Counsel.  (Travarus M. Pierce - #2022006606, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).
Defendant's Motion to Dismiss - Insufficient Preliminary Examination.  (Travarus M. Pierce - #2022006606, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).
Defendant's Motion to Dismiss (Franks-Mann Motion).  (Travarus M. Pierce - #2022006606, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).

Defendant Travarus Marcell Pierce in court with attorney Dianne Margaret Erickson.  Defendant Travarus Marcell Pierce in custody.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defense counsel waived reading of the Information and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.  Defense has discovery.  Defense requests a final pretrial and jury trial date.  Parties advised any motions are to be filed by November 1, 2022.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for January 17, 2023 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Dianne Margaret Erickson in court, defendant Travarus Marcell Pierce not in court, in custody.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Case calendared for Arraignment this date.  Court adjourns matter.  Arraignment scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Filed: Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING (4 pages) commencing 06-08-2022 by Kaitlyn Edwards.

Defendant Travarus Marcell Pierce in court with Attorney Dianne Margaret Erickson; both appear by video.  Defendant Travarus Marcell Pierce in custody.  Jennifer Tate appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective M. Fedel. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed. Defense requests an arraignment date. Case is adjourned to Branch 12.  Arraignment scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Motion to Dismiss from Defendant.

Defendant Travarus Marcell Pierce not in court, defendant in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests the matter be sent to the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing. Request is denied.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.

Defendant Travarus Marcell Pierce in court with attorney Kylie Kaltenberg.  Defendant Travarus Marcell Pierce in custody.  Anthony J Moore appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a Preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.   DEFENDANT QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
